{IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"balanceOfAt(address,uint256)":{"details":"Retrieves the balance of `account` at the time `snapshotId` was created."},"burn(uint256)":{"details":"Destroys `amount` tokens from the caller. See {ERC20-_burn}."},"burnFrom(address,uint256)":{"details":"Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, deducting from the caller's allowance. See {ERC20-_burn} and {ERC20-allowance}. Requirements: - the caller must have allowance for ``accounts``'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"burnRewards(uint256)":{"details":"Burns the proposed amount of tokens after the poll has ended and passed","params":{"pollID":"ID of the poll"}},"checkParticipation(address)":{"details":"Checks if the address of the voter has participated in any active poll","params":{"voter":"Address of the voter"}},"claimVote(uint256,address)":{"details":"Claims votes from existing staked tokens and stores available votes at _votes","params":{"pollID":"ID of vote"}},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"deposit(uint256)":{"details":"Deposits tokens into the stake pool from the users account","params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens the user wishes to deposit"}},"endPoll(uint256)":{"details":"Ends the poll instantly if necessary","params":{"pollID":"ID of the poll"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"isNotExpired(uint256)":{"details":"Checks if a date has expired or not","params":{"_terminationDate":"The date for checking"}},"makeVote(uint256,uint256,uint256,address)":{"details":"Voters makes votes on corresponding polls, deducting their _votes and emitting _VoteMade event","params":{"pollID":"ID of the poll","side":"The side of the poll the user wants to support (1: for; 2: against)","votesMade":"Amount of votes going to be made"}},"mintRewards(uint256)":{"details":"Mints the proposed amount of tokens after the poll has ended and passed","params":{"pollID":"ID of the poll"}},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"numOfVotes(address,uint256)":{"details":"Returns number of votes available to users","params":{"pollID":"ID of poll","voter":"Address of requested voter"}},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"pollEnded(uint256)":{"details":"Checks of poll has ended or not","params":{"_pollID":"ID of the poll"}},"pollExists(uint256)":{"details":"Checks if poll exists and returns a boolean value","params":{"_pollID":"ID of the poll"}},"quorumCalc(uint256)":{"details":"Calculates the percentage of voters that supports the proposal","params":{"pollID":"ID of the poll"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`."},"results(uint256)":{"details":"Returns whether the poll/ proposal passed the voting","params":{"pollID":"ID of the poll"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role."},"revokeStaker()":{"details":"Revokes their staker role and returns all their tokens back to the user"},"stake(uint256)":{"details":"Allows users to stake, adding their respective amount of tokens to the staked balance","params":{"amount":"Amount of tokens used in the stake pool"}},"startPoll(bool,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Initiates poll and emits PollCreate event","params":{"_action":"Type of poll, action 1 is for minting tokens, action 2 is for burning tokens, action 3 is for transfering tokens, action 4 is for taking a snapshot.","_commitDuration":"Length of the poll in seconds","_quorumOption":"Users can decide if the winner is decided by the percentage majority out of 100 or whether the 'for' side has more votes than the 'against' side","_voteQuorum":"Assumes that the _quorumOption is false, passes in the percentage majority out of 100 that is required to win the vote","_votedTokenAmount":"The amount of tokens minted/burned if poll is successful "}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"totalSupplyAt(uint256)":{"details":"Retrieves the total supply at the time `snapshotId` was created."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"viewStakedBalance()":{"details":"Function for users to see the balance they currently have in the stake pool"},"voterAllocation(address)":{"details":"Allocates voter role to stakers and emits event","params":{"voter":"address of staker"}},"voterRevokation(address)":{"details":"Function that takes away voter role from addresses when necessary","params":{"voter":"Voter that is going to get their role revoked"}},"withdraw(uint256)":{"details":"Withdraws tokens from the stake pool back to the users account, the user must not be part of any active polls","params":{"amount":"Amount of approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

balanceOfAt(address,uint256).details: Retrieves the balance of `account` at the time `snapshotId` was created.

burn(uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from the caller. See {ERC20-_burn}.

burnFrom(address,uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, deducting from the caller's allowance. See {ERC20-_burn} and {ERC20-allowance}. Requirements: - the caller must have allowance for ``accounts``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

burnRewards(uint256).details: Burns the proposed amount of tokens after the poll has ended and passed

checkParticipation(address).details: Checks if the address of the voter has participated in any active poll

claimVote(uint256,address).details: Claims votes from existing staked tokens and stores available votes at _votes

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless this function is overridden; NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

deposit(uint256).details: Deposits tokens into the stake pool from the users account

params.amount: Amount of tokens the user wishes to deposit

endPoll(uint256).details: Ends the poll instantly if necessary

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

isNotExpired(uint256).details: Checks if a date has expired or not

makeVote(uint256,uint256,uint256,address.details: Voters makes votes on corresponding polls, deducting their _votes and emitting _VoteMade event

params.side: The side of the poll the user wants to support (1: for; 2: against)
params.votesMade: Amount of votes going to be made

mintRewards(uint256).details: Mints the proposed amount of tokens after the poll has ended and passed

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

numOfVotes(address,uint256).details: Returns number of votes available to users

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

pollEnded(uint256).details: Checks of poll has ended or not

pollExists(uint256).details: Checks if poll exists and returns a boolean value

quorumCalc(uint256).details: Calculates the percentage of voters that supports the proposal

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

results(uint256).details: Returns whether the poll/ proposal passed the voting

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

revokeStaker().details: Revokes their staker role and returns all their tokens back to the user

stake(uint256).details: Allows users to stake, adding their respective amount of tokens to the staked balance

params.amount: Amount of tokens used in the stake pool

startPoll(bool,uint256,uint256,uint256,u.details: Initiates poll and emits PollCreate event

params._action: Type of poll, action 1 is for minting tokens, action 2 is for burning tokens, action 3 is for transfering tokens, action 4 is for taking a snapshot.
params._commitDuration: Length of the poll in seconds
params._quorumOption: Users can decide if the winner is decided by the percentage majority out of 100 or whether the 'for' side has more votes than the 'against' side
params._voteQuorum: Assumes that the _quorumOption is false, passes in the percentage majority out of 100 that is required to win the vote
params._votedTokenAmount: The amount of tokens minted/burned if poll is successful

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupplyAt(uint256).details: Retrieves the total supply at the time `snapshotId` was created.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

viewStakedBalance().details: Function for users to see the balance they currently have in the stake pool

voterAllocation(address).details: Allocates voter role to stakers and emits event

voterRevokation(address).details: Function that takes away voter role from addresses when necessary

params.voter: Voter that is going to get their role revoked

withdraw(uint256).details: Withdraws tokens from the stake pool back to the users account, the user must not be part of any active polls

params.amount: Amount of tokens the user wishes to withdraw
